Class EnemyMissile

  • java.lang.Object
    • DefaultCritter
      • Missile
        • EnemyMissile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Critter

    public class EnemyMissile
extends Missile
    This class extends Missile to add extra functionality for a type of missile that can be used as an enemy missile for the enemies,.
    Author:
    Bradley Fourie, Daniel Banks, Heinrich Benz
    See Also:
    Missile, Enemy

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Missile

        angle

      • Fields inherited from class DefaultCritter

        radius, xCoord, xVelocity, yCoord, yVelocity

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EnemyMissile(Enemy enemy)
      Creates a EnemyMissile using the Missile class as a basis, uses the Enemy it is shot from to determine its starting x and y coordinates.
      EnemyMissile(Enemy enemy, double angleOffset, Shooter shooter)
      Creates a EnemyMissile using the Missile class as a basis, this constructor is used for the BossEnemy, it allows the BossEnemy to fire three missiles at once in the direction of a shooter, each missile having a specific angle that is offset from the middle missile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnemyMissile

        public EnemyMissile(Enemy enemy)
        Creates a EnemyMissile using the Missile class as a basis, uses the Enemy it is shot from to determine its starting x and y coordinates. Enemy missiles have a default radius of 3 and a y velocity of -15.
        Parameters:
        enemy - the enemy that shoots the EnemyMissile
        See Also:
        Enemy

      • EnemyMissile

        public EnemyMissile(Enemy enemy,
                    double angleOffset,
                    Shooter shooter)
        Creates a EnemyMissile using the Missile class as a basis, this constructor is used for the BossEnemy, it allows the BossEnemy to fire three missiles at once in the direction of a shooter, each missile having a specific angle that is offset from the middle missile. The constructor needs to have case checking for the coordinates of the entities as the sign of cosine and sine flips the velocity depending on the angle between the shooter and the BossEnemy due to the nature of these mathematical operators.
        Parameters:
        enemy - the enemy that shoots the EnemyMissile
        shooter - the shooter is being shot at
        angleOffset - an offset angle for when a bullet shoots at a different angle to the shooter
        See Also:
        BossEnemy

    • Method Detail

      • isShooterCollision

        public boolean isShooterCollision(Shooter shooter)
        Calculates the Euclidean distance between the missile and a shooter, and checks if the missile and shooter have collided and then returns true if a collision occurred.
        Parameters:
        shooter - the shooter on the canvas that is being checked for if it has collided with the missile
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if a shooter has collided with the missile else false

      • render

        public void render()
